content: Having both accounts is no problem. On copying the messages, you could highlight the folder and click 'copy to' if only a few messages. If many, I recommend creating a filter to copy (not move) the messages. When done, spot check that the messages are intact. The challenge is that IMAP was not designed for a large number of uploads.
creator: davidsk

content: I am not sure I understand. You can have accounts with nifty and google and view and respond to each individually.

content: We aren't the HTML gurus, but if you can post the complete HTML somewhere for viewing, some suggestions may come forth. Posting HTML on this forum may not work.

content: This is not clear to me. Are you saving in a folder in Thunderbird and wanting the subject to be changed? You can drag messages from one folder to another, but that doesn't appear to be what you want.

content: Folder choices appear in the order selected. So, untick unified folders so that favorite folders is the only one shown. then retick unified folders and that will appear below.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi David,

Thanks for the quick reply, this isn't quite what I meant. I would like the Favourites pinned so if the folder list is much larger than a screen height and I have scrolled the list down to see some folders below, I still wish to have the favourited folders shows at the top of the pane.

I hope this explains it better.
creator: ml17

content: You are wanting it pinned to the top, not subject to scrolling. I am unaware of any way to do that.
creator: davidsk

content: Yes exactly, just pinning the favourite folders. I know that it's not possible yet, this is why I submitted this as a feature request üòâ
creator: ml17

content: If that is your intent, go to connect.mozilla.org and file this under IDEAS. This is the support forum, not for development. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: If I understand correctly, the ability to do that would let people use Thunderbird to send spam. Thunderbird sends the actual email addresss. For replying, you can use the 'reply to' option.
creator: davidsk

content: Was there an explicit error message? Maybe if you post your server settings, someone will have suggestions. Were you able to login the day before the problems surfaced, or is this a new setup? We cannot know causes of problems, only the actions of Thunderbird. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: My guess is the folder is threaded. Highlight the folder with the messages, then click view>sort by and tick 'unthreaded.' If the menu bar isn't visible, click the alt key first.
creator: davidsk

content: Highlight a unified folder, right-click and select 'properties' and then click 'choose' and then tick or untick the folders you want to appear.
creator: davidsk

content: That is because you set up the account on new PC as POP. if you delete the POP account and reinstall as IMAP, you will be able to do as that link indicates. BUT, if your desire is to download permanently to PC to keep, then you would need to then create Local Folders folders and copy the messages to the local folders folder to keep. My inference is that you may not want to keep the old account and you emphasized downloading to your PC.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi David, thanks for your reply.

I deleted everything and re-installed with a new IMAP profile: it appears to have downloaded my email database as required (I have put the pc offline and can still see the emails).

I mistakenly thought I needed to use POP3 to dowload to my pc rather than keep them on the server (which is about to close).

Rgds, Neil
creator: neildp27

content:
That doesn't seem normal, as the release version does not autoupdate to the beta version. Assuming you are on windows, Try: 

   Exit Thunderbird if running.    click windows key and 'r' key    Enter: thunderbird.exe -P --allow-downgrade    click on 'OK'

However, I am not clear on what change you are anticipating to revert, as those two versions have same basic layout.
creator: davidsk

content: This may be a bug, as I saw this problem from another person recently. If I see another incidence, I will file a bug report. Also, please post an issue just once. Thank you.

creator: davidsk

content: I believe the import-export addon can do this. Create a folder in Local Folders, highlight and rightclick and select import-export and click to import mbox. Another approach is to exit thunderbird, copy the inbox message file to Mail\Local Folders folder and restart thunderbird.
creator: davidsk
